name: Akan
description: The native language of the Arah-ka is monotone in nature with very small variations in pitch or speed but utilizes a series of hand gestures are an integral part of establishing meaning.

name: As-Bok
description: The native language of Minotaurs, marked by a distinctly gravelly quality and deep, resonant tones.

name: Common
description: The language that commerce and diplomacy is conducted in between different cultures and language speaker throughout the Viridus Nexus.

name: Elven
description: The native language of Elves which exhibits complex, soft, and breathy patterns, with many words gracefully concluding in a gentle exhale.

name: Giant
description: The ancient tongue of the first Giants now used natively by species with Giants-Blood is filled with long vowels and harsh consonants amplified by deep thrumming from the chest.

name: Goblin
description: The native language of the Goblins, utilizing a broad range of tonal variations, making it sound almost like a melody, with high and low pitches intricately woven.

name: Gnilbark
description: The native language of the Gnolls, featuring a series of throaty barks and growls with volume often indicating different meaning.

name: Hssshek
description: The native language of the Lizardfolk which is characterized by a series of hissing sounds, in which the duration and pitch of each hiss convey different meanings. Some of these pitches extend beyond the normal auditory spectrum of certain ancestries.

name: Lattus
description: The native language of Humans and the origin of the common tongue. This language can vary greatly by region and culture but is mostly utilized in writing and in scholarly texts.

name: Orcish
description: The native language of Orcs which is composed of clipped syllables and a rhythmic cadence like the steady beating of a drum.

name: Qualatiq
description: The native language of Tidewalkers that has a unique trilling sound, with rapid vibrations of the tongue against the roof of the mouth to create sound that travels through water. Using this language to channel spells ignores the penalty from being engulfed.

name: Shimmerspeak
description: The native language of Gnomes which uses a unique whistling sound for certain syllables, creating a musical and airy tone.

name: Sign Language
description: A language of hand gestures and facial expressions that conveys meaning and is used as a primary form of communication by those who cannot speak or cannot hear.

name: Underspeak
description: The native language of the Stout-Folk which is characterized by several vowels strung together with abrupt consonant endings that often sound harsh and breathy.

name: Vethan
description: The language of the Vethi is characterized by elongated vowel sounds and a leisurely pace, creating a calming, drawn-out cadence. The Gloxy, however, speak this language natively with quick, staccato vowels.

name: Draconic
description: The non-magical language of Dragons, often used to communicate with humanoids is fashioned to be a simplified version of the old tongue that incorporates exaggerated emphasis on vowels and the first consonant of each word.

name: Aeron
description: The magical language of Aeron, the upper elemental plane of Sky and the plane of Valor. You can command air with an action, causing a gust of wind to shove a creature. To command air in this way, a fluent speaker of Aeron requires a persuasion check of 9, with the creature you are shoving needing to make a fitness or coordination check greater than or equal to your roll or be shoved 2 units. Someone with mastery requires a 7 and shoves the target up to 3 units if they fail the check. If you fail this check, you cannot attempt to command the element again until you complete a full rest.

name: Arcanascript
description: The written language of magic, allowing a fluent individual the ability to decipher magical runes. Mastery of arcanascript allows a user to make a bonus check to glyphcrafting checks.

name: Chiroglyphics
description: A non-spoken language that uses hand gestures to trace arcane runes into the air, allowing a character to channel spells without needing to speak, bypassing the penalty of channeling without speaking.

name: Divine
description: The language of the plane of Divinity and the entities that reside there. When you channel a divine spell using this language to speak it, the difficulty does not increase for charing a spell. However, if you still fail your spell check, you cannot benefit from using this language to channel divine spells until you complete a full rest.

name: Deadspeak
description: The language of the Dead. A speaker of this language can call the spirit of a recently (within 10 days) deceased humanoid to their corpse by rolling a 1d12. If the d12 lands on a 9 or higher, the spirit is bound to answer 3 questions, otherwise the spirit can refuse to communicate. Calling forth entities like this has some risks.

name: Old Draconic
description: The magical and ancient language of the Dragons, passed on to their chosen people ages ago. A user of this language can telepathically speak to a creature within a moderate (20 unit) distance.

name: Infernal
description: The magical language of the Infernal, the lower elemental plane of Fire. You can command fire with an action, causing a flame to either spread to an adjacent object/creature or be extinguished. To command fire in this way, a fluent speaker of Infernal requires a persuasion check of 9, while someone with mastery requires a 7. If you fail this check, you cannot attempt to command the element again until you complete a full rest.

name: Orycotal
description: The language of the Orycotal, which can only be heard by individuals who the speaker wishes to hear, otherwise it is undetectable.

name: Okkor
description: The magical language of Okkor, the upper elemental plane of Earth and plane of Growth. You can command the earth with an action, moving up to 1 cubic unit of minerals like rock, dirt and silt to an adjacent area. To command earth in this way, a fluent speaker of Okkor requires a persuasion check of 9, while someone with mastery requires a 7. If you fail this check, you cannot attempt to command the element again until you complete a full rest.

name: Sylvan
description: The magical language of the Fey, allowing the user to speak to plantoids and beasts. The beasts and plantoids can understand simple concepts from the speaker but can not communicate back unless otherwise capable.

name: Abyssal
description: The magical language of the Abyssal Plane, the lower elemental plane of Water. You can command water with an action, moving up to 1 cubic unit of water. To command water in this way, a fluent speaker of Abyssal requires a persuasion check of 9, while someone with mastery requires a 7. If you fail this check, you cannot attempt to command the element again until you complete a full rest.

name: Void Speak
description: The language of the void. Terrible and guttural, this language calls upon the darkest depths of the shadow planes to drive creatures to insanity. A creature that is fluent in this language can dim lights and mask shadows in a short (10 unit) radius by making a persuasion check of 7. With mastery of the language, this effect also causes minions and thralls within that radius to become maddened if they fail a resilience check of 4. If you fail this check, you cannot cause this effect again until you complete a full rest. Using this language, especially failing, runs the risk of attracting entities from the shadow planes.
